title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 205.8 - Regional fire administrators and their duties
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 205.8 - Regional fire administrators and their duties

State Regulations
(a) A regional fire administrator shall be
appointed for each fire mobilization and mutual aid zone. It shall be the
policy, where practicable, to appoint as regional fire administrator the person
holding the county office of county fire coordinator, except in the case of
counties comprising the City of New York where it shall be the person holding
the office of chief of department of the fire department of the City of New

York. (b) The regional fire
administrator, for practical purposes, assumes the position of county fire
coordinator upon the activation of the State fire mobilization and mutual aid
plan. He is empowered to: (1)
dispatch
manpower and equipment of fire departments consistent with maintenance of local
fire protection; (2)
coordinate the
response and assignment of manpower and equipment, such manpower and equipment
being under the command of the fire chief requesting assistance. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
205.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
